title: Outrage as government advisor posts Islamophobic pictures of prophet Muhammad
text:
Local Muslim party members are demanding tougher action from the Labour Party

British Muslims have expressed outrage after a government advisor and Labour party member shared offensive cartoons of the prophet Muhammad on his Facebook page.

Martin Bridgman, an advisor to the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government, shared cartoons of Jesus and Muhammad that alluded to ‘child rape’.

His posts between November 2018 and March 2019, were only discovered three months ago, after a Muslim member of his local Labour party in Ilford, made a complaint, MailOnline reported.

One of the cartoons Mr Bridgman shared, shows Jesus questioning the Prophet Muhammad on his marriage to his third wife Aisha, which some allege took place when she was only nine years old.

The Labour party says that it has placed Mr Bridgman under investigation.

However, Muslim members of the local party have criticised Labour for not acting swiftly enough, demanding party bosses take a tougher stance.

Martin Bridgman shared offensive cartoons of Jesus and Mohammed

The Labour party says it is investigating Mr Bridgman

One such member, Labour councillor Khayer Chowdhury, also from Ilford, said he was ‘shocked and distressed’ when he saw the posts on Facebook.

An MHCLG spokesman said: ‘While we cannot discuss individual staffing matters, the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government takes a zero-tolerance approach to any form of racism or religious discrimination.

‘Discriminatory behaviour of any kind is completely unacceptable. We expect all departmental employees to uphold the values and behaviours of the Civil Service as set out in the Civil Service Code.

‘We will take appropriate action where people fall short of that expectation.’

The Labour party says it has a ‘zero tolerance approach towards complaints of this nature’ and that it could not comment on individual cases.
